summary:
It’s funny how Daensa is now the trendy w/w ship for Sansa when Sansaery is right there. 
I can see what you people are doing...
body:
It’s funny how Daensa is now the trendy w/w ship for Sansa when Sansaery is right there.

I can see what you people are doing and it’s not pretty.

blog.name: athimbleful

summary: Playing devils advocate here:  What's the difference in the BotB script pages and TDatW pages?  Both are basically telling the...
question: Playing devils advocate here:  What's the difference in the BotB script pages and TDatW pages?  Both are basically telling the audience what they should see.   What they want the audience to believe, Dany dark unfeeling, not quite human, dragons are war machines and Jon in love.  Why does the audience believe one and not the other?  Why is one descriptor used as a misdirect and the other is straight forward?
answer:
BotB: they need to show us moments of dark!dany or else her descent in s8 will be completely out of the blue. In this case they’re showing us the truth, but using other moments later on to once again hide it. They do this with her very, very often. Both by letting her oscillate between benevolent and cruel, and by letting other characters comment on scenes we’ve just seen but in a way that leaves them in a positive light.

Two examples:

  • A scene of D*ny feeding a potentially innocent man to her dragon as a scare tactic cuts to a scene of Sam reading news from Essos and saying she sounds like quite a woman! 
  • A scene of D*ny behaving so badly on the beach Jon rolls his eyes and exchanges looks with Davos and watches Team DS to see whether this is normal for them (cuts to scene at WF which) cuts to scene of Davos saying he’s noticed Jon staring at her good heart.

Because we’re often left on a positive note, that’s the lasting impression. Something s7 as a whole is a good example of. Many casual viewers were bothered by her behavior only to land on her being a hero again once she chose to go north after all. 

TDATW: they’re hiding plot twists. Some of these plot twists were revealed in the same episode (Euron and Cersei’s deal; Sansa putting LF in trial not Arya), others will be revealed in s8.

Bias does its part too, of course. People are more inclined to believe D*ny will do something heroic and Sansa will deceive her family for many reasons. Part of it is first impressions. D*ny was presented as an underdog, something we’re conditioned to root for, while Sansa was presented as a Popular Girl, someone we’re conditioned to interpret as fake and scheming–especially when juxtaposed with a loveable, cool tomboy who refuses to conform–and we therefore want to see taken down a peg or two. Especially after she did the ~huge crime~ of not seeing the Lannisters for what they were. Part of it is D*ny’s history of liberating people and Sansa’s history of being forced to interact with and appease and even marry enemies of her house. Part of it is D*ny constantly triumphing over those trying to put her down while Sansa’s put in one abusive situation after another where she can do little to change it and therefore is perceived as weak. And so on.

All of this has led to our supporting D*ny or giving her the benefit of the doubt when she does questionable things while we’re not at all as generous with our interpretation of Sansa. (But this has started to change too. More and more people like her and the fact that she’s taken down two of the show’s biggest villains absolutely had something to do with that.)

A general audience is easily swayed, though, because they’re not as deeply invested as fans (or stans) are, and so it won’t take much to get the general audience to see things differently in s8. Most of them will probably root for whomever the narrative wants them to root. And s8 will be a good season for Sansa.

Thanks for the ask!

blog.name: ode-to-an-inkwell
blog.title: You Can’t Frighten Me
blog.description:
Lit major | Writer | House Stark loyalist🐺

AO3: ode_to_an_inkwell

summary: Hey! How do you think Sansa and Cersei will meet again? Do you think it would be voluntary/involuntary? How do you think Cersei...
question: Hey! How do you think Sansa and Cersei will meet again? Do you think it would be voluntary/involuntary? How do you think Cersei would react to who Sansa has become? And, if Sansa was taken involuntary, how do you think Jon will react- or Arya?? I don’t know if I want Sansa to be kidnapped, the only thing I’d like to see from that scenario is a confirmation of Jon’s feelings and Sansa outwitting Cersei ❤️
answer:
Hello dear!

Honestly, I’m with you. The only things I like about a kidnapping plot are 1) Sansa’s fulfillment of the YMBQ prophecy and 2) the potential outburst from Jon.

I do find it likely that Cersei has hired the GC to kidnap Sansa. It not only feels appropriate for the show, but also allows for the subversion/fulfillment of Sansa’s narrative tropes/arcs. Sansa has been “the lady stuck in a tower” before. This was left unresolved because rather than defeat her enemies, Sansa has had to flee them. She was taken first by Cersei, then LF, then Ramsay in the show. Sansa killed Ramsay in S6, LF in S7, and I think it likely she will defeat Cersei, her oldest enemy, in S8. There has also been quite a lot of foreshadowing for it in the show, as we all know.

What mostly sells me on the validity of the kidnap theory is that Cersei needs leverage. Sure, she’s sitting pretty from KL while everyone else fights the dead, but she’s absolutely betting on Jon and D. She assumes the dragons can handle the dead, and why shouldn’t she? She knows, however, that Jon and D, as they’ve presented as allies, will come for her eventually. Cersei cannot leverage a dragon, but she can leverage a wolf. I think she’s guessing—and correctly—that Sansa is a weakness of Jon’s.

Character reactions:

Cersei’s might be the most interesting for me. That off kilter mother/daughter dynamic reminds me of Dangerous Liaisons, except Sansa is no Cecile. Sansa has learned the game, and Cersei will no doubt feel some pride mixed with her rage. I also think Cersei is tired of watching her prophecy play out. She’s known her end was coming since Joffrey’s death. Remember when Tommen died, and she couldn’t say anything except to instruct his ashes be buried with Margaery’s? Cersei might even be relieved to know her death comes soon, and that it comes from her “Little Dove” rather than the Dragon.

Jon’s reaction will be my favorite. It’s pure Jonsa angst, it’s tropey, it’s a huge reveal, and it could all be ours! I honestly think Jon leaving D to save Sansa is the cleanest, most dramatic way to reveal his feelings. Bonus points for drama because, as the show has established, Sansa is Jon’s weakness. His reaction will be everything, and his overreaction is the key to selling a Jonsa endgame.

Arya’s reaction will hurt me. If her sister is taken, Arya will be feeling guilty and scared for her. Like Jon, Arya now understands that KL was traumatizing for Sansa. Neither rescued her last time, but they might team up to do so in future.

However, I don’t think that Sansa needs rescuing from Cersei. Back in S1 Cersei made a fool of not only Sansa but Ned, as well. Since then, Sansa’s narrative has been about proving that a wolf can outwit a lion. If written properly, it could be glorious. I wanted to do a kidnapping fic back when we got the set pictures of Jon kneeling for Cersei, but depression. Since then, @athimbleful has written a kidnapping fic which I think is a really good take—the plot points it follows make narrative sense and keep characterizations intact. As happens in the fic, I think Sansa will keep a level head if kidnapped and find a way to save herself. If not, what’s the point?

Thanks for the ask! 🌻

summary: i remembered dimwits on twitter saying ‘at least [redacted] kills house stark’s enemies, what has sansa done?’ when i say this...
body:
i remembered dimwits on twitter saying ‘at least [redacted] kills house stark’s enemies, what has sansa done?’ when i say this fandom is stupid, i’m not being harsh. ramsay and littlefinger died recently, winterfell is back under stark control because sansa convinced littlefinger and knights of vale to fight on her side, the north is prepared for war against the night king because sansa prepared for it. joffrey died because sansa told the tyrells about his true character and brought the poison with her. even when her agency was small she was still affecting the plot greatly. lysa died because she tried to kill sansa which in turn allowed sansa to win the loyalty of the lords and ladies of the vale long before they helped her kill littlefinger, for example.

what a dumbass fanbase

summary: anyway sansa not telling jon about the vale army for a variety of reasons (like what if they don’t show up?) is mirrored by jon...
body:
anyway sansa not telling jon about the vale army for a variety of reasons (like what if they don’t show up?) is mirrored by jon not telling sansa about kneeling to dany until a while after it happened. i actually doubt he mentioned the dead dragon or the size of dany’s army as well as how much food they’re bringing with them.

almost as if the two of them have trust issues and are still learning to working together instead of sansa being a unique type of evil

almost as if the two of them have trust issues and are still learning to working together instead of sansa being a unique type of evil

summary: Do you think it's possible Sansa being the only northerner displeased with J's bending and alliance with Targs? J ofc will...
question: Do you think it's possible Sansa being the only northerner displeased with J's bending and alliance with Targs? J ofc will promote his new gf as the only chance for survival and everyone will buy it. There won't be Glover who was the only vocally against Targs. D&D have no problem with pushing Sansa at the vanguard of hatred. They wrote the conversation with LF about D*ny's beauty, they can go far and portrait her as petty/ jealous. And they love to use Sansa to prop up other characters.
answer: It’s possible of course but Emilia said Dany enters Winterfell cocky before something knocks the smugness out of her. I’d love it if Sansa alone is capable of doing that but one person can’t compare to an entire kingdom. I think a lot of people will oppose Dany and reject Jon relentlessly, as in nothing Dany does will win them over especially if her dragons are killing livestock and possibly eating people. I do think Sansa will support Jon after expressing her disappointment in his lack of trust.

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams
blog.title: Enjoy the little things!
blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

tags: I'm sorry that all my current fics are so dramatic
the three last lines totally give the ending away
title: Family
body:
Written for Day 5 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt CELEBRATION or REUNION or FAMILY

Sansa has it all. She has married her king, strong and gentle and brave. She is living the fairy tale life in Winterfell. And she has a beautiful baby boy. But an old promise to a red haired lady years ago threatens it all and Sansa fears there is no way to ever see her baby boy grow up.

Fairy Tale AU // Rumplestiltskin AU 

“What happened?” Jon rushed into the nursery. He had one hand on the hilt of his sword, but Sansa didn’t dare to look at him.

She simply pressed their baby boy as tightly to her chest as possible while she allowed her tears to roll down her cheeks and her neck. She should have known that this moment was coming. She she should have known that at some point the red lady would collect the price Sansa had agreed to pay her. Sansa should have known, the moment she discovered that she was pregnant, that she would not see her kid grow old.

“Sansa?” Jon wrapped an arm around her shoulders and his lips kissed her forehead. “You’re upset.”

Of course she was. She was happier than ever. She was married to the strong, gentle and brave man her father had promised her. She was holding a wonderful baby boy. She was living the life of her dreams. But it all came crashing down. It all came crashing down because of her own desperation to live without truly understanding the consequences.

“Talk to me, please.” Jon let his head rest on hers, but she doubted if he would still be this sweet and kind if he knew the truth, if he knew that she had promised a stranger her first born baby if that stranger would help her to take care of Ramsay Bolton.

“I can’t.” She shook her head. “You’ll hate me.” She sniffed and she pressed her wet lips on the forehead of her baby boy. “I hate me.”

Jon’s grip around her tightened and for a moment he simply rocked her back and forth without saying anything. “I won’t hate you.” Jon eventually whispered. “I can’t hate you. I love you too much for that.” His words were soothing, just like his voice, but Sansa knew he didn’t know what he was promising her.

Just like she hadn’t known what she had promised that stranger two years ago, when Ramsay Bolton had almost broken her and the wrong God had listened to her prayers. “She’ll come to get him.” Sansa swallowed. “When I was…” She closed her eyes and took a deep breath. She had never talked about this. She had wanted to forget about it and she had hoped that the stranger would do the same. “I didn’t just escape Ramsay.” She felt her heart racing in her chest, but in the back of her mind she heard her father and mother, telling her that the ugly truth was always better than a beautiful lie. “I got help.” She looked up at Jon and shook her head. “I didn’t know what I promised. I didn’t know, I swear.”

“What did you promise?” Jon spoke softly. “I really wanna help you, but you have to tell me everything.”

And so Sansa did. She told him about the red haired stranger who had shown up, assuring her that she could get Sansa out, that she could help Sansa escape the strong claws of the monster. She told him that the stranger had wanted the ring she had gotten from father to leave the door of her room unlocked. She told him that the stranger had taken the necklace she had gotten from mother to sedate the hungry dogs. She told him that the stranger had wanted her first born baby to make sure Ramsay would never come after her. And eventually she told him that she had agreed.

She had been foolish. She had been naive. She had been on the brink of dying. And she had given this beautiful baby boy up before she had even met him, without realising what she would truly be giving away.

“Why did you never tell me that?” Jon’s voice was calm, but she saw the pain in his eyes, the disappointment. “Why didn’t you trust me?”

“I did!” She replied. “I just wanted to forget. I wanted to forget about Ramsay and his dogs. I wanted to be happy. I thought…I hoped…” She wasn’t sure what she had thought and what she had hoped. “She’s coming back in three days. I tried to promise her gold and diamonds and brocade instead. I tried to promise her a title and a crown and a castle. But she still wanted the baby.” Her chest went up and down rapidly. “She said that nothing was worth as much as a baby with royal blood.”

Jon clenched his jaw, but he kept his arms firmly around her. The frown on his forehead deepened when he looked at his son, smiling and giggling in Sansa’s arms. “There has to be a way to stop her.” He hissed between his teeth. “There has to be something we can do.” He tensed all his muscles and he buried his nails in Sansa’s shoulders. “I can’t let her take our son away from us. I won’t. Over my dead body.”

“I’m sorry, Jon. I’m so sorry.” Sansa took a few deep breaths. “If I had known…”

“It’s not your fault.” Jon grabbed her chin and forced her to look at him. “If you hadn’t agreed, you would have died there. Ramsay would have…” Jon almost choked on the words. “That woman took advantage of a broken girl with nowhere to go and no other choice. She’s the one who was wrong. And she’ll pay the price for it.”

Sansa bit her lip. “She can’t be killed, Jon.” Sansa shook her head once more. “I tried to threaten her, but she told me that the only thing that could kill her, was her name.” She felt her shoulders shaking. “I don’t know her name. She says no one does.”

“She’s wrong.” Jon used his hands to wipe the tears from her cheeks. “We have Bran. Bran knows everything. Bran sees everything. He can find her name. If he has to, he can find the moment her parents gave it to her. And when she returns we will use it to destroy her.”

Sansa focussed on her breathing. In and out. In and out. She knew that she wouldn’t fully calm down until that red woman was destroyed and gone. Until their baby boy was safe. Until they had cleaned up her own mess. But Jon had given her something she had thought she had lost.

Hope.

Bran could figure this out.

That name would destroy the red lady.

And Sansa, Jon and their baby boy would get their happily ever after.

“It’s not your fault.” Jon grabbed her chin and forced her to look at him. “If you hadn’t agreed, you would have died there. Ramsay would have…” Jon almost choked on the words. “That woman took advantage of a broken girl with nowhere to go and no other choice. She’s the one who was wrong. And she’ll pay the price for it.”

Sansa bit her lip. “She can’t be killed, Jon.” Sansa shook her head once more. “I tried to threaten her, but she told me that the only thing that could kill her, was her name.” She felt her shoulders shaking. “I don’t know her name. She says no one does.”

“She’s wrong.” Jon used his hands to wipe the tears from her cheeks. “We have Bran. Bran knows everything. Bran sees everything. He can find her name. If he has to, he can find the moment her parents gave it to her. And when she returns we will use it to destroy her.”

Sansa focussed on her breathing. In and out. In and out. She knew that she wouldn’t fully calm down until that red woman was destroyed and gone. Until their baby boy was safe. Until they had cleaned up her own mess. But Jon had given her something she had thought she had lost.

Hope.

Bran could figure this out.

That name would destroy the red lady.

And Sansa, Jon and their baby boy would get their happily ever after.
trail.content_abstract:
Written for Day 5 of @jonsaspringblossoms based on the prompt CELEBRATION or REUNION or FAMILY

Sansa has it all. She has married her king, strong and gentle and brave. She is living the fairy tale life in Winterfell. And she has a beautiful baby boy. But an old promise to a red haired lady years ago threatens it all and Sansa fears there is no way to ever see her baby boy grow up.

Fairy Tale AU // Rumplestiltskin AU 

“What happened?” Jon rushed into the nursery. He had one hand on the hilt of his sword, but Sansa didn’t dare to look at him.

She simply pressed their baby boy as tightly to her chest as possible while she allowed her tears to roll down her cheeks and her neck. She should have known that this moment was coming. She she should have known that at some point the red lady would collect the price Sansa had agreed to pay her. Sansa should have known, the moment she discovered that she was pregnant, that she would not see her kid grow old.

“Sansa?” Jon wrapped an arm around her shoulders and his lips kissed her forehead. “You’re upset.”

Of course she was. She was happier than ever. She was married to the strong, gentle and brave man her father had promised her. She was holding a wonderful baby boy. She was living the life of her dreams. But it all came crashing down. It all came crashing down because of her own desperation to live without truly understanding the consequences.

“Talk to me, please.” Jon let his head rest on hers, but she doubted if he would still be this sweet and kind if he knew the truth, if he knew that she had promised a stranger her first born baby if that stranger would help her to take care of Ramsay Bolton.

“I can’t.” She shook her head. “You’ll hate me.” She sniffed and she pressed her wet lips on the forehead of her baby boy. “I hate me.”

Jon’s grip around her tightened and for a moment he simply rocked her back and forth without saying anything. “I won’t hate you.” Jon eventually whispered. “I can’t hate you. I love you too much for that.” His words were soothing, just like his voice, but Sansa knew he didn’t know what he was promising her.

blog.title: rebellions are built on hope
blog.description: I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.

summary:
I LOVE the dynamics between the Stark siblings:
-Jon and Robb grew up together, they are best friends. And they are an example...
body:
I LOVE the dynamics between the Stark siblings:

-Jon and Robb grew up together, they are best friends. And they are an example to the youngers.

-Jon and Arya, his little sister. His heart. They have a connection none other character has. They are soulmates.

-Bran and Arya, very close in age. I cannot count how many times Bran remembers Arya, misses her, looks up to her, … They ressemble Lyanna and Benjen quite a lot.

-Rickon and everyone, but specially Bran and Arya. He is their baby brother. They protect him like mama wolves (lol Arya punched Jon for scaring him, cutest thing ever).

-Bran and Jon. Bran saved Jon (as Summer) when he left the wildings. And Jon braved Catelyn to say goodbye to an unconcious Bran.

-Arya and Robb, she looks up to him so much. They were so close at the Twins and yet so far thank the old gods for that, I cannot think about how things would have been if Arya had been recognised.

-Sansa and Arya, as different as the sun and the moon, and yet they have a connection.

Pretty sure I’m missing sth, but this sums it up.

summary: A pure world, Sansa thought. I do not belong here. Yet she stepped out all the same. Her boots tore ankle-deep holes into the...
caption: A pure world, Sansa thought. I do not belong here. Yet she stepped out all the same. Her boots tore ankle-deep holes into the smooth white surface of the snow, yet made no sound. Sansa drifted past frosted shrubs and thin dark trees, and wondered if she were still dreaming. Drifting snowflakes brushed her face as light as lover’s kisses, and melted on her cheeks.
